private_information: I can manipulate vowel-labeled blocks only: A, E, I
I can only move the top block of a stack and move one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, and K on the table.

private_information: I can manipulate consonant-labeled blocks only: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K
I can only move the top block of a stack and move one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, and K on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' reports into a single PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that achieves the final stacked ordering: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on the table.

public_information: There are blocks labeled H, D, F, G, C, K, E, A, I, J, B.
Initial stacking configuration: H is on the table, D is on H, F is on D, K is on F, I is on K, J is on I, B is on J. Separately, G is on the table, C is on G, E is on C, A is on E.
Agents may only move the single top block of any stack and may move only one block at a time.
One agent may move only vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I) and the other may move only consonant-labeled blocks (B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K).
The goal is to produce the target stack ordering: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, and K on the table.

report.system_prompt: You are a specialist agent that inspects the blocks world and reports observations, constraints, and a local move sequence applicable to the vowel blocks. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on describing legal moves, blocking relationships, and a stepwise local plan for vowel blocks only.
report.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You may only move vowel blocks A E I. Given the public information and your private information, list the current positions of A, E, and I, identify which top-of-stack constraints affect them, list the legal move actions you can perform, and propose a step-by-step local plan that only moves vowel blocks and respects the one-top-block and one-block-at-a-time rules.

report.system_prompt: You are a specialist agent that inspects the blocks world and reports observations, constraints, and a local move sequence applicable to the consonant blocks. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on describing legal moves, blocking relationships, and a stepwise local plan for consonant blocks only.
report.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You may only move consonant blocks B C D F G H J K. Given the public information and your private information, list the current positions of these consonant blocks, identify which top-of-stack constraints affect them, list the legal move actions you can perform, and propose a step-by-step local plan that only moves consonant blocks and respects the one-top-block and one-block-at-a-time rules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in producing PDDL compatible with the FastDownward planner. Integrate the agents' textual reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode: top-only moves, single-block-at-a-time moves, distinct action permissions for vowel and consonant agents, the initial configuration, and the specified final stacked ordering. Target FastDownward compatibility and include any required :requirements and typing. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the reports from vowel_agent and consonant_agent to produce a single PDDL domain and problem that solves the global goal. Keep actions distinct for the two agents (for example, move-vowel and move-consonant or similarly named actions) and encode the permissions so only vowels can be moved by the vowel agent and only consonants by the consonant agent. Ensure the domain encodes that only the top block of a stack can be moved and that moves place blocks either on the table or on top of another block. Provide the final domain and problem suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
